full_text:
Activities

Lesson
objectives

¢ Define an Activity as the term is used in
PolicyCenter

¢ Explain the difference between a Manual and
Automatic Activity

¢ Define an Activity Pattern

¢ Describe the Activity life cycle

¢ Discern an Underwriter Activity from a
General Activity

Tanya
Customer

Service
Representative

~~

When | start my day, | want to know what | have
to do. Does PolicyCenter give me a task list?
What does it look like, and how does it work?

| Activities G
« Area way to keep PolicyCenter
users informed about important tasks

| 009 | related to
) * accounts

* policies

ae, & — * transactions
* Can improve workflow
| oe | * Can be manually or automatically

created using business rules

| Activity assignments Gi

Automatic

Manual

PolicyCenter uses pre-defined business rules to create the activity.

Business cases: PolicyCenter is configured to create an activity that alerts a
supervisor if a specific task is past due.

Business case: PolicyCenter creates an activity when an external system fails
to complete its experience task (for example, DMS failure)

A PolicyCenter user can make requests to other users or can create self-
reminders.

Business case: Manually create an activity to request internal personnel to
rate and quote a policy submission.

Business case: Manually create an activity to request underwriter review.

| View activities in the Desktop Gi

Desktop » Account ~ Policy ~ Contact ~ Reinsurance ~ Search ~ eam Administ

Gi PolicyCenter™

My Activities

* Due in five days

®*

If there is a policy submission that carries
significant risk, | need to know. Is there a way to
receive notification so | can review the
submission myself?

| Types of activities in PolicyCenter (1 of 2)

¢ General activity is a task to do; no authority is involved in completing task

| Types of activities in PolicyCenter (2 of 2) Gi

¢« AGeneral activity is task to do, but no authority involved in doing task

¢« An Underwriter review activity requests underwriters to review underwriting
issues

What you can do with activities

Creating an activity

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

/~ — Give one example of how an activity can help users manage their work.

4
4
¢

Sooo o oe Sooo ooo oOoOeD

Gi

Answer

¢
4
7
¢

Sooo oo ooo ooo oOo OOoS

Give one example of how an activity can help users manage their work.

Assign work to a user, alert users to certain events, manage how policy jobs are
completed.

Gi

Question

_~ — What business objects can have an associated activity?

4
4
¢

Sooo o oe Sooo ooo oOoOeD

Answer

_~ — What business objects can have an associated activity?

4
4
¢

Sooo oo ooo ooo oOo OOoS

Accounts, policies and transactions (jobs).

Question

ae What is an activity pattern?
4
¢

Sooo o oe Sooo ooo oOoOeD

Answer

77
4
7
¢

Sooo oo ooo ooo oOo OOoS

What is an activity pattern?

An activity pattern is a description of how to create a specific activity.

Question

ae Is an activity always assigned to a group? A user?
4
¢

Sooo o oe Sooo ooo oOoOeD

Answer

77
4
7
¢

Sooo oo ooo ooo oOo OOoS

Is an activity always assigned to a group? A user?

Activities can be assigned to users, groups or queues. In addition, a user is assigned
to a group; a queue contains activities assigned to a group.

Question

,- — Who can modify an activity?

4
4
¢

Sooo o oe Sooo ooo oOoOeD

Answer

77
4
4
¢

Sooo oo ooo ooo oOo OOoS

Who can modify an activity?

The activity owner and anyone with manager permissions.

General Activity
